description: Ancient Greek κηρός (kērós, “wax”) +‎ -ene; a name trademarked in 1854.

entries.meaning: A thin colorless to straw-colored petroleum-based fuel heavier than gasoline/petrol or naptha but lighter than diesel, used primarily as jet fuel but also for heating and lighting in some remote or impoverished areas.
examples: The kerosene lasted all winter, so the furnace kept us always warm.
